description:
I don't know how to convey how much I enjoy this bar.  All I can say is that it's my absolute favorite place for post-work cocktail. They're moderately priced, the natural lighting from the skylights is perfect, the bartenders are really nice, and there's a good amount of seating.  

Tried to have my birthday party here but didn't realize how popular it was for private events.  So plan ahead!  And contact them first to see if you can reserve the upper area.
author: Cori A.

description:
It gets crowded, but that's for a good reason:

-great drinks
-fairly priced for the area ($12/craft cocktail, unsure if they have well drinks)
-great natural lighting during happy hour
-comfy couches if you can snag one, or sit at the bar. otherwise you may end up standing
author: Katherine G.

description:
As the youngins' say, this place is pretty hip! I came on a Friday evening around prime Happy Hour time (6pm) and was surprised to find the atmosphere comparable to a frat party -- everything from the music, to getting spilled on my tipsy people, and even just to the general age range of the patrons reminded me of being in college again. 

Drinks are pretty strong and are an average price for SF although I wouldn't want to spend too much time around the bar as it gets cramped quickly. There's a sweet upstairs area you can check out but again, if there's too many people it can feel a bit stifling. 

Overall, a cute little spot to check out! It's a bit more lively and raucous than neighboring happy hour spots but if that's your vibe, this place'll be perfect!
author: Christine W.

description:
Came here after work on a friday with a coworker and man is this place poppin'!! Love the atmosphere and decor, but very very crowded (seemed to clear out around 7pm). They have an upper area for seating but it was reserved for a private event. Staff who cleared drinks were very attentive despite how busy it was. 

Ordering drinks at the bar was a bit hectic, but we tried both the sonny cricket and basil higgins ($12 each). We both agreed that the sonny cricket was much better- the agave made it sweet but was balanced nicely with the grapefruit! 

Would definitely recommend and come back again- maybe when it's less busy!
author: April L.

description:
This one is taking me back! 

While in a nearby bar reminiscing about Captain America's visit to said bar during my last visit to SF, I was reminded of Natoma Cabana and the great time we all had. When I went to check for my review I realized I NEVER WROTE ONE! 

Hmph... How could that happen? I'll blame the old fashioneds (with proper ice cubes and premium whiskey) and the awesome vibe in this bar that had a few of us staying way past everyone else! 

Natoma Cabana is at the end of a street/alley somewhere near FiDi, and I highly suggest you use Yelp maps to get you there. I think they qualify as a hidden gem because of the location, unique array of seating options, including some namesake cabanas, proper cocktails, and aforementioned premium selection of whiskeys! They also have a rad area upstairs too for big groups or private parties. 

From our experience this seems to be a popular spot for people visiting SF for work. We came as a big group and slammed the bar all at once, but right behind us was another group of colleagues, and behind them another! 

Four stars here simply because even before it got busy, the service was a little off. I know I was overlooked quite a few times and I don't really appreciate that, especially when you've given them every sign you want to order or pay. There's definitely an art form to being behind the bar and recognizing everyone, and whoever was there that night wasn't on their game.
author: Michael T.

description:
There's a huge neon sign that says "LIQUOR" so you know where to order drinks. (Even if you hardly know her.)

Once you get to the bar though, it isn't always as easy to get some booze as one might like. The bartender alternately gave me a little attitude when I ordered a vodka soda (which I'll never understand, it may be basic as hell I'm giving you too much money for the easiest drink you could possibly make...which will help you with quick service, an apparent issue of yours), and ignored me in favor of the beautiful ladies in the area (which I absolutely understand, but don't really appreciate). 

The cocktails are well made though; I liked the Goldfinger (like a Gold Rush, but with rye) and the Watchmen (whiskey, benedictine and fruitiness), even if they are a bit sweet, and the comfortable cabana seating makes for a nice spot to lounge around. The music had the ladies dancing, which is always a plus.

All in all, a solid bar, especially when it isn't too busy.
author: Peter D.

description:
I really liked this tiny little bar off the beaten path. We basically invaded the bar with a large group and the ONE lone bartender handled it like a champ. While there was a wait for drinks, he was still upbeat and had every order correct. 

I ordered the sparkling rosé. The rosé itself was great! I also had a fab old fashion. I love the comfy cabana seating. It's lends to a fun and laid back atmosphere. Also a plus, really great playlist!
author: Rachel C.

description:
Such a cute bar! I was introduced to this bar by some coworkers and I'm glad we came here. The Dj was great, and the ambience is great if your looking for a hipster type tiki bar. They have swinging chairs and cute signs around the place. 

We had to stand the entire time that we were here since it was a Friday and packed. It wasn't packed to the point where I wanted to leave, but they lack seats. They have a upstairs area which can be reserved for private events which is pretty small as well. 

The bartenders were kind of attentive and their drink menu is pretty solid. Good place to chill and have a great time.
author: Mehak D.

description: Love this place.  Cool atmosphere, really chill, and when it's not too crowded it's literally perfect.  Seems to be a popular to place for private events though so sometimes it does get super crowded and if the upstairs area is reserved it's kind of a shit show to sit around the bar.  Bar staff is great though - they make some delicious cocktails.
author: Jessica F.

description:
Good thing it took so long to get a drink from the bar, otherwise my tab might have hit 3 digits! 
This place is rad, cool layout, nice vibe, decent music playing.. I came here with a crew from work and we took over the bar area, and naturally I seemed to be the only one in the place drinking beer, which is very easy to pop a cap, or flip a metal tab.. but everyone else seemed to be buying cocktails that has 38 ingredients making the poor bartender, work his butt off. But I didn't feel to sorry for him, cause I caught him making out with someone behind a door while there was like 30 people waiting for drinks.. But then again I kinda tip my hat to the guy for being able to multi task while at work!
author: Patrick T.

description:
Natoma Cabana is a little off the beaten path (deep in FiDi), but a nice spot for a client meeting or hanging later at night! A tad on the pricer side, but you pay in part for the vibe. 

There's a nice upstairs area that could be fun for a birthday party or work party! 

Every time I've been in they've had different DJs that play great music and gives the place a nice upbeat feel. 

Would recommend!
author: Drew F.

description:
This place was so loud and crowded when I went. I came with some co-workers and if you're looking for a lounge to chat and unwind, this isn't the best place because it's so loud. 

I'd recommend this place for good music and dancing.
author: Tuyen T.

description:
Loud music. 

People watching. 

A lot of hipster/techie.

This sound like a place I might want to skipped, but ended up here on Friday when bar hopping with my friends. To my surprise, I love it! 

Upstairs and downstairs seating. Great atmosphere and decoration. The drinks could use a little more work, it was so-so. I think I might need to try a few different drinks to compare next time. 

Overall, I do enjoy this bar. I hope you give this cocktail bars a try! Cheers!
author: Owie N.

description: I went on a Friday during happy hour time after work hours, and it was insanely loud. I like to talk to (not shout at) people at happy hour!!  It was still light outside (and thus, inside), so the volume just didn't match the vibe. Got beers so can't say much about the drinks, but didn't have a huge wait at the bar.
author: Thu P.

description: Cool decor. Friendly good looking staff. Had the diablo, which can't really go wrong with tequila mixed with...anything really. Overall laid back fun vibe. Would def go back.
author: Linda H.

description:
First of all, I'd like to apologize to the bartender for having him charge 3 cards for the 3 drinks I ordered for myself and my two friends.  I know it's a faux pas, but we didn't have cash so it was easier for us to just use our cards without owing each other money.  Though annoyed, I'm thankful the bartender ran our cards.

With that said, I haven't been to Natoma Cabana since a Yelp Elite event several years ago, so I'm happy that they are still up and running.  My friends and I were here on a hot Friday night, and it was crowded.  We found seating in the loft, but unfortunately that's where all the heat was accumulating.

We ordered two Caribbean Zones and one El Cholo.  The Caribbean Zone was good.  It had rum, lemon, and passion fruit.  Unfortunately, my friend who ordered the El Cholo could not drink it.  It had mezcal, pineppale, and mint, which sounded good to her, but I guess it wasn't executed properly.

The atmosphere is very loud.  It's a small venue, so the crowd plus the music drowns out everything.  Plus, there's currently a lot of construction outside due to the Salesforce, so it's just noisy all around.  The seating on the ground floor is cute with couches and cabanas, while the loft has one couch with wooden seating on the side.

All the cocktail drinks were $12, which makes picking a drink easier.  But it seems like the quality of the drinks are inconsistent.
author: Vira P.

description: I had a really great time at Natoma Cabana! We actually stopped by because we had some time before a dinner reservation and it was close by. But I'm so glad we did!! I read in reviews about how crowded it can get here, and I'm not sure if it was because it was a little early for drinks (around 630PM) but there was only one other party when we got here. It was so cute and nice inside! Good music playing, cute places to sit. There's a nice upstairs which was warmer, so we sat up there.  This could be a nice date spot but also a very chill place to come with your friends. The bartender was nice, and made a great moscow mule!! :D I guess I dropped my credit card somewhere, and he found it and brought it to me. I just loved how cozy it felt here. I would like to come back!
author: Christine Y.

description:
I guess it was kinda cool sitting under a giant rattan breast, as I nursed from Mother Gaia a too sweet $13 cocktail, but at the end of the day, it was a bar with a neon arrow and a fairly dickish bartender who spent more time eyeballing the fairer sex than, yknow, tending bar. 

Tight Spotify playlist on the 1s and 2s, though. Really wish I hadn't gotten the stink eye from the staff for the supreme insult of mentioning, when asked, that my drink order had not been taken yet. Otherwise, this might get Clark Bar (aka Lark Bar) rotation when in town. Til then, it's on the back burner.
author: Damien S.

description:
Natoma, you made me want to get my hula on! 

When you've had a long day at work, sometimes you just need a drink. A fancy tropical one at that! My large group of colleagues and I walked over to Natoma's since it was just down the street from our office. If I didn't have a large group to follow, I might not have found it as easily because it's tucked away in a street corner behind some building. 

Now, I'm a fan of tiki bars. Something about the tropical vibe, pretty string lights, and yummy drinks, just give me all the happy vibes. The minute you step into Natoma you're taken into a tropical oasis. There are paper lanterns and string lights hanging from the ceiling, big, cozy cabana lounge chairs throughout the whole lower level, and tropical cocktails to match. They also have an upstairs area, which apparently is really nice and much more spacious, but I never had the chance to check it out.  

It took a long time to order drinks and for them to show up, but hey, I'm giving the guy a break because he was by himself and just got hit with a 50-60 person rush. Besides, the vibes were so great at this place that I just didn't mind standing/sitting around talking to people. When I was able to order a drink, I grabbed myself a tequila pineapple mule. No complaints, it tasted like your typical tequila pineapple mule. Pretty hard to mess up that drink. 

I'm a fan of all the Natoma vibes. I'm sure I'll be back on my next trip to SF.
author: Issabelle F.

description:
Torn between 3-3.5 stars

INSIDE
Ambiance is nice, but that's probably the best part. It is VERY drafty; they keep the door open, so dress warm if you come on a cold day. That said, I think this place would be better during the summer.

DRINKS
Cabernet was not good, but the Odeon (vodka/champagne/lemon) is tasty.

FOOD
There is no food, but you can bring your own.
author: Nic Z.

description: Good beer selection. Good cocktails. Perfect Old Fashioned. I dig the natural light, various seating options and the decor of this place. Very light and welcoming versus other bars in the area. Good vibe. Have been here many times with colleagues and friends. I recommend trying to show up just before 5 if possible. It will get packed Thursday and Friday after 530.
author: Michael M.

description:
This place is hidden, but it's a sweet spot for happy hour in SoMa. 

They have decent prices for happy hour with cocktails running $12 and beer and wine running anywhere from $4-$9. It's small and can get crowded and loud pretty fast, but the service is good and the decor is fun. Seating is very limited so the bartenders WILL kick you off the bar if you're not gonna order another drink. 

The place has a great mezzanine that overlooks the whole bottom floor, great place for a small reserved party if you call ahead. 

Definitely worth checking out for after-work drinks or a night cap after dinner.
author: Anna P.

description:
Natoma Cabana is a hidden but cool bar in FiDi. The space is really cool and when we were there on Friday at around 8:30pm, it was buzzing but not packed. Most of the crowd appears to be from the offices around, notably LinkedIn. We definitely felt like the right demographic for the bar and felt comfortable though. We were a bit cold since the space is drafty and they leave the door open. It seems to be a converted storehouse with a loft area. Wicker furniture fills the space which feels pretty appropriate and adds to the tropical atmosphere.

I ordered El Diablo and A had the Smokestack #2, both being $12 which is pretty standard. It took a bit of time to get served by a bartender when it wasn't extremely busy but the drinks take time to make so I get it. We got our drinks and sat on a couch for some people watching.  El Diablo was a tasty, light drink which I appreciated. It was refreshing but not too sweet. I would definitely order it again. The Smokestack #2 was very very strong and I personally hated it. A seemed to think it was fine but would probably get something else next time.

I think we will be back as this was a good place to hang out for an hour and seems to be a good addition to the area. I imagine it would be a really cool place to rent for an event or take an out-of-town guest.
author: Carrie W.

description:
How have I missed this gem!? If you haven't been, Natoma Cabana is a bar that's off 2nd and Minna. Rather than stay on the main street you head down an Alley and you enter a white/black building and wonder if it's the right place since there's no sign outside. 

I came around 5:30PM on a Thursday and the place was PACKED. I definitely recommend coming early if you're coming with a larger group. They have an upstairs/downstairs area with booth seats but those fill up quickly. If you're not lucky enough to grab one of the stools near the bar you'll probably be left standing. 

Drinks to get: 

+ Floridian - Second fave! It's more on the frutier side of things but it's a deeper flavor than the other drinks. 
+ Basil Higgins - my fave! If you like gin and want something refreshing this should be your go to drink! They don't skimp on the basil that's for sure.
+ Odeon - tasted like a mix of lemonade/mimosa. Definitely lighter than the normal mimosas.

The bartenders were great! The one serving us was very attentive and made sure we were always taken care of. I don't think we ever had an issue flagging our bartender down even during the rush. I accidentally knocked over my drink while getting back into my stool and he brought me a new one without me even asking!

PROS: 
- Service
- Clean bathrooms
- Great drinks 
- Nice ambiance 

CONS: 
- The place gets packed 
- Can get loud and hard to hear your group 
- Limited seating for big groups
author: Keizzel C.

description:
Attentive staff
Good cocktails
Not crowded on a weeknight 
Fun atmosphere
Jungly
author: A H.

description: I had a great time here and would definitely come back. Yes, the service was slow but we were rolling deep with our coworkers so they were pretty slammed. There was some great lounge chairs where someone may have taken a nap and the bar had an overall cool-kid vibe. When Francis broke out the splits on the dance floor the party hit its peak and you could see it was going to be "one of those nights". Honestly though, the cocktails were top notch and that's what will bring me back.
author: Scotty C.

description: Pretty cool hipster environment and I liked the two tier structure. It's a really convenient location for both Bart and Caltrain as well as working or living downtown. However, the outside looks like a fairly bad neighborhood and the staff was very neglectful. They seemed pretty content with serving their friends first and any one else after. Additionally, they certainly had ignoring people down to a science. SUPER long wait time to get a drink. Also, it was loud enough and the staff turned up the music which was odd.
author: Tim D.

description: Hosted an office happy hour here recently and really loved the space. It's quite small, but when we went it wasn't busy and we could enjoy the space and spread out. They don't serve food so I brought my own food from a local taqueria and Natoma Cabana was kind enough to supply us with a table to place the food on (if you do this the set up is out in the open, so you might get a couple of strangers nibbling on your food). There were 1-2 bartenders throughout our time there and the drink menu had a variety of different cocktails as well as house wines and some beers. Our group enjoyed the shang-a-lang and ordered it for several rounds. I really enjoyed the seasonal IPA they had, as well as a drink the bartender made when I asked for a spicy tequila drink. Upstairs looked really nice- perfect for private parties but unfortunately the minimum was a bit high for a small group like ours. I would definitely recommend it if you have a decent sized group or people coming throughout the night. I also think Natoma is a really nice place to host a holiday party if you rent out the whole space. Definitely want to come back and Eric, who we communicated through, was nice and accommodating as well.
author: Hannah K.

description:
This place is pretty cool. I came here to attend a private event. I was a little unsure if this was the correct place because it's at the end of a road that is right next to a bunch of construction. There is a green arrow pointing to their entrance in case you aren't sure where it is. They did have a small chalkboard sign outside saying there was a private event that night. 

It's a little escape from the city once you walk inside. They have some nice patio furniture for their seating. There are a few big plants that make it seem like you are on vacation. There is a good amount of seating around the bar, which is nice. They have some string lights above the loft space. The bartenders were good at making the drinks for all of us there. They put on some good music while the basketball game was on TV. 

The menu has some unique cocktails, beer, and wines. I tried about five of their cocktails. Sonny Crocket was probably my favorite because it was refreshing and not too strong. The Triumph, Tropic Thunder, El Cholo and Caribbean Zone were fruity tasting but a little stronger. I had a sip of the Old Manhattan and that was definitely the strongest alcohol tasting one.
author: Nicole S.

description:
This place is really pretty and gets packed. I've been here twice. The cocktails are actually quite good. All of them are a flat $12. My favorite is the el cholo. Mezcal, pineapple, and lime. So good and refreshing. 

Cute place, good drinks, conveniently located less than 20 minutes walk to my home, so I can stumble all the way back! Yeah!
author: Priti K.

description:
I hosted an event in Natoma's upstairs space last week with about 20 guests. The space has a laid back, loft vibe and was perfect for a casual post-work gathering. Coordinating with the venue was super easy and the staff was very responsive. The beverage minimum was super reasonable for a party of our size.

Two pieces of criticism, although neither was actually "bad" by any stretch. The upstairs space could have used a better temperature control system (it got hot up there) and some of the cocktails were pretty intensely sweet. All in all--great for our group and would use them again.
author: Lola C.

description:
Came here last night with a friend and his coworkers on a Saturday night around 7pm or so. It wasn't too crowded and it was the perfect place to hang out and just chat with a few friends. Love the ambiance, seating, beer and service! I just got a beer on tap... not too sure what the name of the beer was but it started with an A... LOl. Just ask the bartender and he will let you know what's good. 

This place is in the Fidi district so it's the perfect place to go after work and it's also hidden in one of the alleys... definitely a fun discovery! Would definitely come back and try their wide selection of cocktails next time!
author: Amy L.

description:
Natoma Cabana is a cute little sanctuary in my neighborhood. Sometimes it's very chill and perfect for intimate dates. Other times, it's loud, crowded, and has great music.

I love the soft lantern lighting, the comfortable patio-style seating inside and the upstairs area for more privacy. The drinks are consistently good and the bartenders are extra friendly.

I would highly recommend this gem if you're looking for a fun place to grab a drink after work or spend time with your date.
author: Yi Z.

description:
Aesthetically, this is the coolest bar in FiDi and SOMA, especially the upstairs area. Walking into Natoma Cabana feels like instantly being transported into a tropical vacation. There is comfy lounge furniture if you have a small group of friends or don't feel like chatting up the bartender in the barstool area. Immediately I went upstairs to explore and found the wooden benches and cute décor all to myself. 

When my friend arrived for our catch up session, we went back downstairs to order our drinks at the bar. The friendliness of the bartender matched the lively vibe of the bar. I ordered a Whiskey Vic in honor of my friend Vic... Also because it's a whiskey drink. It was icy and sufficiently strong. A little pricey but expected for a fruity cocktail in this neighborhood.

This is a popular spot for private events. My friend and I even got kicked out after a certain time to make room for a party. I would totally love to have a social function here in the future. The themed décor is already in place and makes everyone feel relaxed as they unwind with a tasty alcoholic beverage.
author: Stefanie C.

description:
Nestled on a side street between 1st and 2nd in SOMA, Natoma Cabana is like a little greenhouse booze filled oasis.  My fiancé and I wanted to grab some pre-dinner cocktails in the area and after striking out at a couple other places (too crowded or not yet open) we walked over to this spot that I has bookmarked on Yelp a few weeks ago.  Immediately we walked into a sun-filled room that reminded me of something out of Florida where I am from.  This isn't a cheesy tiki themed bar like smuggles cove with fake pirate ships, but more of a sunroom or green house feel that is natural and comfortable.

Early on a Saturday night, it wasn't too busy in here, but I could see this being a hot spot during the weekday happy hour crowd.  We walked up to the bar and grabbed a few drinks and headed upstairs to people watch and enjoy the giant skylights.  This place would be perfect for a large group get together.  Upstairs there are built in booths, small tables and lounge chairs for seating and you can look over to the first floor and watch all the action down below.  This bar had such a great relaxing vibe, good drinks and great service. A definite new go-to cocktail spot if I am ever in the area again.
author: Kelsey B.

description:
I came here for a bday party that rented out the upstairs space and thought it was a great low key venue. 

Venue itself is down an alley off New Montgomery St so I didn't even know it existed until the invite so it's nice that it's not overrun with a lot of tourists, etc. 

Inside is nice, exposed brick walls and twinkle lights strung up. It had a really nice atmosphere, very hipstery. 

Drinks are what you'd expect for SF prices - $10-$13 depending on the drink. No food. Bartenders were cool and got the drinks out fast (mind you it was really slow other than our party so not sure how quick they come out on busy nights).
author: Mandi W.

description:
Great drinks and (usually) not too packed, Natoma Cabana always feels like a secret tucked away spot in the middle of the otherwise bustling SoMA nightlife. If you're walking by Novella on a Friday night and are immediately put off by the overflow of suited tech bros wearing backpacks, walk a couple of blocks to this place and give it a shot.

Caveat up front: this is a pretty boring space. It should be pretty obvious from the pictures that there is some quasi cabana treatment happening but it's kind of like they gave up 1/4 of the way into the design. You should set your expectations to "I'm avoiding sweating in a packed space and I need to drink now."

With that out of the way, they have plenty of standard spirits available and the bartenders are always pretty cool. The upstairs lounge area makes the vibe a bit better so I'd recommend snagging some of those seats if you can and wasting your night away up there.
author: Matt M.

description: This is not a bad bar, and definitely not a great one. It's a cozy size, some really interesting beer options. Slow service was an issue and I found the decor fairly random and not to my taste. Ok, tacky and not in a good way. Vibe is better than a lot of bars in the immediate area but it won't jump to the top of my list. I'd love to see this bar get it together and be more professional and less try hard. It has so much potential!
author: Risa D.

description:
It seemed like I was never going to get to go to Natoma Cabana because every time I tried to go, there was a party or private event booked in the space. But, I had my farewell happy hour here in April and we were pleasantly surprised that they let us reserve the upstairs space. Albeit, it was a Tuesday and we were bringing about 20 people throughout the night. 

The drinks were good and the ambiance was nice. You do have to bring your own food if you think you'll get hungry while you're there. We just ended up heading over to Uno Dos Tacos afterwards.
author: Ada C.

description:
I was charged $98 for a $7 beer on my credit card, and this merchant ignored my phone call and message regarding the matter - forcing me to take action through the credit card company. I even had the receipt.

It's a shame because in the past I have enjoyed this bar, but I found their lack of assistance after grossly over-charging me to be disappointing.
author: Jillian Z.

description:
As a private venue, Natoma Cabana is awesome! There's a lot you can do with the space. It's pretty neutral to begin with so you can make it what you want. It'll transform accordingly!

Not only is it pretty charming, lots of comfy couches, ample space, cool loft, and lots of fun times to be had. 

I can't attest about a regular night here, since my first time here was for a private party but I'm sure it's poppin!
author: Shereen A.

description:
Visiting Natoma Cabana is like going on a mini island vacation. The lounge chairs, palm plants, and paper lanterns contribute to that relaxing feel. It definitely takes you away from the noise and chaos of city life. 

I came here for a private event. The bottom floor was pretty packed and there were 2 bartenders there to handle the crowd. I was impressed at their ability to keep calm as more and more guests appeared. My boyfriend and I ordered the Basil Higgins and Caribbean Zone. Both drinks were quite delicious. The Basil Higgins possesses a strong basil taste that isn't overwhelming and the Caribbean Zone is refreshing and fruity. Cocktails are $12.

Natoma Cabana is a great place for hanging out with a group of friends. Place is somewhat small so come early to grab a seat.
author: Katie C.

description:
This place is pretty packed when I showed up around happy hour. I was out a bit earlier than my friends so I decided to go and grab a drink close to the dinner spot. This place has a great upstairs (that get rented out at times) with a bright sunroof. 

Drinks were great and the bartenders too. Hard to find seating, but not impossible. 

Protip: get there early.
author: Nina Y.

description: This place wins for ambiance, not so much for cocktails. It's a great spot at tucked away at the end of Natoma Street. Really cool entrance, fun decor and vibrant after-work scene. However, I recommend sticking with wine for drinks.
author: Marisa R.

description:
Would recommend avoiding. Brought in a group who all had a similar impression. First time at this place. 

Drinks fair. 
Decor OK. 
Woofer meant for a stadium that they kept turning up with each new song. It literally knocked a cabinet door off which broke a group of people's glasses.  Impossible to hold a conversation. 

Snarky bartender.  Rude when asked to turn down the music abit and oblivious to the fact that everyone was either leaving or escaping to the far end of the bar to get away from the noise. 

We headed to other bars and had a better night.
author: Bill Y.

description:
I LOATHE! DESPISE! this place. I will give a full review of the drinks, service and venue below.

Service: If I could give a review of below 0 then I would. I had a contract with this event. Not only did they BREAK CONTRACT, but they took over 1000 dollars from us and refuse k their owner Eric is standing by the bartenders. From 9-2 we gave this place service and our friends paid gratuity all night. The bartenders stole extra gratuity for themselves and charged our card 4x the amount we owed. 

Drinks: watered down and overpriced. Whiskey sour tasted like a Mike's hard lemonade. 

Venue: this place has a lounge feel because there is a lot of seating, but don't waste time dressing up for a lounge. Sneakers and a t-shirt are fine. 

Location: In an alley. This place should close down. Maybe if you're a construction worker working in the vacant lot behind it and you want a drink, this is your place. 

DO NOT GIVE THIS PLACE YOUR BUSINESS
author: Rashida C.

description:
Such a fun spot. Tucked down a quiet street is this hidden gem. 

Great atmosphere. AMAZING music everyone would know. There isn't a cover charge (WHICH IS INCREDIBLE for the City) :-) This is one of the only places that doesn't play their music so loud you can't hear yourself think. 

There is a great loft available for small private events. 

My only complaint for an overall fun Friday night experience: There are only two bartenders so they are pretty understaffed. Getting a drink can seem like it takes a lifetime.
author: Chris S.

description:
This spot has a great interior and it feels like you're in a little island paradise right in the heart of SOMA. It's a good space for a group (about 10~ people) event like an after work happy hour or celebration. They have an upstairs section that can be reserved.

I like their drinks as well and they've got a good selection for everyone's needs. I haven't seen any bites here which is why I'm knocking a star off. I like having something to snack on as the drinks keep flowing.
author: Renu A.

description:
Ok the location and the ambiance is kinda cool.   There is no happy hour and and the drinks are average 12 bucks for cocktails.    Cheapest beer is $5 dollars. 

It does feel like a beach cabana though so besides the lack of Happy Hour and steep alcohol.  You come here because its cool inside and outside.   It gets 4 stars just because of that.
author: Homer S.

description:
They WAY overcharge for their whisky. And when confronted, they resort to just mocking their customers.

I ordered Akashi, a Japanese whisky. I ordered one for myself and another for a friend. When I got the bill, I was shocked that they charged me $25 per glass, because I know for certain that it's a bottle you can pick up for $40 at a liquor store.

When I confronted the bar tender about the price, he laughed out loud at me. And he accused me of being misinformed.

I told him that I've paid much less at another local bar, and he just continued to mockingly belittle me.

I get that this is the Bay Area, but over charging and belittling the customer seems a bit questionable.
author: Howard S.

description:
A solid 3.5 stars. 

A new place for some nice drinks. Standard San Francisco pricing of $12-13 per drink, and pretty standard drinks. There is no happy hour deal for the cocktails. There is also no food. Overall, the place gets very packed during the after-work hours and the DJ blasts the music to the point that you can not hear anything. 

This place has a lot of potential. They really should get some cuban snacks and a happy hour deal.
author: Nikita K.

description: This place used to be called tom collins, i can't really point out what changed, but it's still a decent place.
author: Michael E.

description:
SUPER fun Happy Hour location. My office hosted a happy hour here a couple weeks ago and everyone had a blast. The staff was super friendly and helpful with setting up for the event. They allowed us to cater in outside food which was nice too! 
There drinks are on point!! They have some delicious cocktails. The bar itself has great ambiance and decor. 
The only downside was this place gets packed and there were only two bartenders. I wish there were more, but all in all a great experience.
author: Makenzi B.

description:
Enjoy this place before the Transbay is complete and this gets swarmed. Great bar, solid drink selection in the rum/scotch/whiskey/bourbon department and some great cocktails (Flordian, old Manhattan, Diablo (tequila) were all very good).

Particularly nice place if you have a group of 6+ as there are a number of places where you can all sit, rather than serve as a massive obstacle and cause a traffic jam between the door and the bar.
author: Mike V.

description:
Love the vibe. Love the drinks. Love the atmosphere. 
But it's just so damn hard to get a drink at the bar. 

All three times I've come it's been a struggle to get anywhere near the bar. Getting a bartender's attention isn't hard, and the bartenders are all beautiful and friendly, but they're just busy as f*ck because cocktails take a long-ass time and the bar here, at least for the ratio of how large the rest of the space is, is teeny tiny and I don't know that it allows for more than 2-3 people behind the bar. 

Again, the drinks are delicious and I'd love to come here and get several rounds but I just don't have the fight in me to battle through the often crowd and try not be cut by some SOMA business bitches and then battle again to close out my tab so I tend to one and done it, or plan to take turns with friends on who fights the crowd and buys the next round. 

If you can reserve the upper area and maybe work out some system for getting drinks for your group, Natoma is absolutely perfect. And same if you get there super early and can procure yourself several drinks and a nice cabana seat, but avoiding the rush is imperative to your sanity... know before you go, but you def should go.
author: Candice G.

description:
I have been here a couple of times for parties and it can get really packed, because the upstairs loft isn't that big. The ambiance is nice on a quiet night. 

HOWEVER, I have called this bar over 30 times in the last week trying to get a hold of someone in order to ask whether an item I lost has been turned in to them. My calls have not been answered once, and the message I left on their machine has not been returned. I just want to ask about my item! Sheesh.
author: Emily J.

description: Didn't think much of this hole in the wall but it turns out it was a fun experience thanks to the bartender Eric Ochoa. He made us feel welcome while serving other guests and cracking a few laughs. He's a cool guy! Ask for "The Oxnard"/"The Ox" a new drink he made for us, which we recommend.(We're from Oxnard)
author: Nate E.

description:
This place is great! Always busy at Happy Hour but still great service from Aaron... in face all of the bartenders take great care of their customers! They can make ANYTHING, a sign of a great bartender, for sure! Their cocktail menu has been dreamed up by the team and has some great options if you're looking for something new to try! 

The atmosphere can get loud at the peak times, but live music from a DJ, it expected... but we have been later in the evening, post happy hour and bellied on up to the bar in a much more chilled out environment.
author: Sarah S.

description:
Directions to this hidden paradise: 
- Walk on 2nd Street towards Market Street
- Turn right onto Natoma Street 
- Walk all the way down until the dead end
- Enter through the door that has a neon arrow above it

The decor downstairs is pretty tropical and fun. They have couches and chairs everywhere, so get comfortable! A stairway upstairs leads to a more intimate lounge area with wooden benches, chairs, and tables. Being able to check out the drinking scene downstairs from upstairs is pretty amazing! 

The music they play here is A+. They were playing some old school R&B on a Tuesday. Talk about a great ambiance for drinks with friends!

I love the hanging lights and the "liquor" sign above the bar. ;) Snap a picture because it looks good on Instagram!
author: Christine S.

description:
$10 (sparkling) wine
$12 cocktails

Tommy Bahamas kind of vibe with wicker seating for groups and a smaller upstairs portion. It looks like you can reserve sections ahead of time. Bartenders are friendly and they pour to the rim. I only had a sparkling rosé so I can't comment too much on the beverages. Notably, we stood not sat as it got popular after 5pm.
author: Tammy T.

description:
I had a Valentines day party here with about 100 of my friends- and it was AMAZING. The bartenders/bouncer were so friendly and the contact was simple easy and great to work with. My party had the best time ever and I could NOT recommend this venue enough. 

Thanks guys!
author: Grace G.

description:
One of the few bars in the area open in the early afternoon on a weekday. I'd say that deserves 4 stars already!

*Montgomery ($11): rye, italian vermouth, maraschino, bitters
*TKO: rye, mezcal, bitters

Drinks are nice and stiff. I got the TKO. It was actually my first meal of the day so it's not so stiff that I couldn't drink it. (Yes, a drink is a liquid meal! Hehe!)

We were here on the Friday before President's Day weekend so it wasn't very busy. Got there around 3:30pm and it was practically empty. Sat at the bar for one drink.

Cute place for a quick drink. I'd probably only come here mid-afternoon. Happy hour might ba a little too crazy for me. Plus, I hate waiting for drinks!
author: Elena N.

description: DJ killed the vibe...way too loud. Don't get me wrong - I love good music but when it interferes with good conversation I'm out.
author: Olivia R.

description:
Natoma Cabana is a cool bar, though if you don't know about it you're sure to miss it since it's on a very discreet corner and there's no signage for it.  Once you go inside you'll notice right away the very tropical hut-like atmosphere this bar is attempting to create.  They have a good amount of lounge chairs on the main bar floor and they also have a nice upper level loft that overlooks the lower floor.  

The cocktails here are solid and are moderately priced at $11 each.  I had the Watchman which is made with whiskey, benedictine, grenadine, orange juice, and lemon.  It's a refreshing drink but it has a enough whiskey to get your alcohol buzz going.  

Overall, great bar in the SoMa \ FiDi and if you can get a spot upstairs in the loft, it's a good space to gather with a group of friends or coworkers.
author: Rodney H.

description:
Really enjoyed this bar! I was surprised how tucked away it was, you probably wouldn't notice it if you were just walking by. This made it even better. It was pretty packed last night (Thursday) when I went around 8:30 pm and only got busier as the night went on.

The bar itself is really cool, with little huts, couches, lanterns, etc. The music was good but the volume seemed to fluctuate a lot...so it would be on the quieter side then suddenly would get really loud. 

My cocktail was one of the better ones I've had in SF -The Verde Club (gin, curacao, aperol, amaro & lime). If you like gin with a (not too) sweet and floraly taste, this is the drink for you. I would most definitely go back and get the exact same drink again and again.
author: Ilana B.

description:
Drinks here are good and strong, not at first sip but wait for it. The staff is friendly, always a plus. Unless it's busy there are areas where you can sit and have a conversation without yelling - definitely worth a visit.

This is an between drinking place or a good pregame spot. It's never been a destination for me but a always a stop and then on my way to somewhere else. Perhaps because it's somewhat in a hidden alley.

Bonus: youtube.com/watch?v=KKsVhyiISY8
author: Peter L.

description:
This place is just cool: The art on the outside, the minimalism inside (also, it's probably smaller than it seems, but they surprisingly have more seating than the average cocktail bar), having an up and downstairs, and the drinks are just gooooood. They were a bit pricey, or probably just pricey for me, but I liked that they were made with quality ingredients, like homemade simple cane syrups, etc. I feel like I'm being a suck-up or a bartender's "pet," but honestly, that is where it's at. 

When we went, we were served by Charles, Erick and Troy. These guys are phenomenal. They really try to make their rounds across the bar, so no one is awkwardly waiting for eye contact to buy a drink. You can tell they really care about the drinks they make, too. The presentation was so nice and they asked after almost all of our drinks how we liked them. Not used to that service at a cocktail bar! They are really funny, too, but didn't try to intrude on our night. It was as if they were having as good of a time as the rest of us, which is awesome because that scene can be all hustle or a bit stuck-up, but not for these guys and not at Natoma!
author: Ariel L.

description:
As I was walking around San Francisco like a yuppy tourist from San Diego, it started to rain, forcing my wife to find a place to seek shelter via Yelp. She said she found a place and refused to tell me anything about it. Always being one up for anything, off we went. Walking in to Interval I was stunned, in wonder and amazement. The decor is fantastic. I have no other way to explain what I was seeing, but I was all in. Taking a seat at the bar, we were 2 of 4 people in the place due to it being mid day on a weekday. The drink menu was filled with various, well thought out drinks that only a good mixologist could think of. Seeing as how they were a bit heavy priced (not for SF), I opted for some unique beers from Norway and Sweden that I've never seen before.

We forced the bartender into conversation with us and had an awesome time talking about the city and its polar contrast to our home, San Diego. The conversation actually kept me ordering because A. I had no desire to really go anywhere else. B. The Bartender was rad and a pleasure to talk to. and C. The beers were great. Fast forward 2 hours and we decided to break for a meal up the street. Out of the dozens and dozens of places I went in San Francisco, Interval is always the first to come to mind as far as awesome places to drink and meet with friends. Even a large party can be accommodated.
author: Nick B.

description: Went there for after diner drink on a Friday night. Very nice place and atmosphere. Service was good and friendly. The music is a bit loud but good selection !
author: Vincent J.

description:
I came here for a Yelp Elite event and really liked this spot! 

The entrance is tucked away at the end of an alleyway in SOMA/Fidi. It's unmarked but the front of the building is covered in a beautiful black & white mural: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/natoma-cabana-san-francisco-3?select=yJJza0QwtBrQLLLyaeXpeA#yJJza0QwtBrQLLLyaeXpeA

Inside, there's a lofted upstairs area in the back. The bar is long and there are comfy couch seats downstairs and up. The walls have exposed bricks, and they have lights dangling from the ceiling rafters, giving it a homey-chique vibe: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/natoma-cabana-san-francisco-3?select=yJJza0QwtBrQLLLyaeXpeA#h6yqBkKDHZJaApPDkrOmwQ

The bartender/owner was really nice and talked to us for a bit when my friend was interested in renting out the space for an event or party.

We got to try a mezcal and tequila drink - I loved the mezcal one! Smokey, spicy. Strong but didn't taste too boozy. Both drinks were well-balanced but I liked the more distinct flavors of the mezcal.

We also got crostini bites which were good but not super memorable.
author: Ziyan C.

description:
Stopped in with friends for drinks before having dinner at Jersey around the corner.

We were the only people there, so the bartender was chatty and knowledgeable about some liquors.

Some drinks were better than others, and prices were reasonable for the area.

*If you aren't looking for this place, you'll never find it! It's down an alley with a small sign.
author: Amanda G.

description: Live DJ on some nights, great atmosphere and they make great mezcal cocktails.
author: Briget P.

description:
Easily my favorite FiDi/SOMA watering hole after a long day. The cocktails are good and you can usually find a seat before 5:30PM. Feels tropical and light inside with some serious bartenders to help you out. 

Upstairs can be reserved for parties really easy. We had plenty of work events here.
author: Marcus D.

description:
Had to give one star because the DJ and the music volume. 

Both of the DJ's were playing top hip-hop songs that sounded like they were remixed by a 9 year old. It sounded like they were going to Biggie's and Tupac's MySpace pages and playing random remixed videos that were posted there 15 years ago. 

The volume was loud enough for a medium sized concert venue. There is about 12 feet between the speakers and a brick wall. People asked them to turn it down and they laughed and put their DJ headphones back on. Yeah bro those things protect your ears and you have no idea how loud it is. 

Perfect spot to go around 1:00 am to dance to some super loud music when you are already hammered and don't mind screaming in people's ears to tell them the music is too loud and then saying, "what!?" And then they say something to you and you say, "what!?"

Was much better 3 years ago when they had different DJ's. The place looks cool and has a cool upstairs area. Kind of sad what they are doing to it. Our group of 20 had to leave to find somewhere that didn't make our ears bleed.
author: Eric H.

description:
I was lucky to have an opportunity to go to Natoma Cabana on their grand opening day.  As always, Southside and Kate's were both packed after work on a Thursday evening so I took the lead and brought my coworkers to Natoma Cabana after reading about it in Eater SF.   

The inside is pretty cool with the natural light skylights, tall ceilings, and natural wood benches.  They didn't have all of their beer taps working and I didn't see that they had a floor server but perhaps they may not likely ever get one.

The benches are located on the top floor where you can gaze out into the skylight window and see the vista of the surrounding SOMA office buildings.  On a late sunny summer day, it's really a one-of-a-kind experience!

In terms of drinks, most drinks were served in pint glasses like the Kentucky Mule that I ordered.  They had no beer glasses so they were serving that in red Solo cups.  Prices were about on par with SOMA norms.

I'll be coming back but most likely it will be way more crowded than my first time.
author: Ben H L.

description:
Everything was cool with this place until I got the bill.. 

Came here for a Finals Warriors Game and it wasn't too packed half way through the first quarter. We were able to get a seat at the bar and stayed there the whole game. Mind you, we were ordering drinks throughout the whole game. At the end of the night I picked up my tab and saw there was an extra $10 cocktail and 3 extra well drinks.  I told the bartender what we ordered and which ones we didn't order and he said he would take care of it. He reversed my previous receipt but the new one he made still looked a little off. I told him that it still wasn't right and he told me he made it to give me a small discount for them messing up the first time. Just wanting to leave, I paid and left. It wasn't until we already left that I realized that I was still over charged by $13 plus the tip I gave them. 

Overall, I thought this place was chill but them messing up my bill twice just made me not want to come back here again.
author: Paul U.

description:
Feels like you've walked into a tropical oasis, if you are lucky enough to snag what limited seating they have 
Drink selection is robust and can make things off menu
Cool private upstairs area (reservations accepted)
Sound system is loud and can be hard to chat especially when the DJ is there 
This place gets packed so keep that in mind

Overall Thoughts

If you can make a reservation, you'll have a much better experience
author: Eddie W.

description: This is a cool spot to go after work to grab a nice drink and hang out for a bit. The decor is tasteful and eclectic yet warm and inviting. HOWEVER, there is one bartender who has repeatedly snubbed me and my group of girlfriends. It's a shorter guy who wears his curly brown hair in a pony tail--he's super aggressive, unfriendly and snappish when we order our drinks. To even get him to notice us is a huge ordeal and he always calls on guys who lean over and shout their orders over your head. When we order a round of shots he actually said 'Oh my god, seriously?' Overall nice place but not the spot for ladies who are allowed to vote.
author: Elisa M.

description:
Fun vibe, designed to create a relaxed atmosphere, but inevitably feels overly cramped and obnoxiously loud once the after work crowd envelopes the bar and the music overtakes everything.

Arrived around 4:30PM on a Wednesday to meet some friends for drinks... thankfully we beat happy hour crowd. They must not have started the happy hour yet, because beers were regular priced (starting around $6) and all cocktails were a flat $12. The contrast on the menu design was a little intense, so I asked what was on tap and proceeded to go with a Guinness. 

A few observations:
* Floor plan - Aside from the bar & the loft space above (which was being used for a private event), there's some really comfy looking furniture on both the left/right sides between the entrance and the bar in the back... this worked beautifully when there weren't that many people, but once people started pouring in after work, it absolutely killed the more relaxed vibe that we were enjoying. The seating looked really comfy, but we all quickly sinked into the seats a little too much and we all had to reach uncomfortably far to sit our drinks down on a small cylindrical piece of wood. It's one of those things you don't think about until you sit there for a while and realize you're slowly inching further and further out of your seat just so that you don't have to get up and grab your drink for a sip. 

* Noise level - Other Yelpers commented about the noise level, especially in the loft area. I've been to enough bars to understand that there's only so much control the owners have over the noise level... though my gripe was that before the crowd even get mildly loud, the guys at the bar seriously cranked up the hip hop on the speakers to the point where the I couldn't even hear my friend that was sitting right across from me. I just kept thinking to myself, "why is this necessary? Isn't this incredibly easy to balance with the existing noise of the crowd?" It really conflicted with the relaxed vibe that the plants, string lights, and comfy furniture had created.

Thankfully I didn't have to wait at all to order a drink and didn't have to fight to find a seat, otherwise I don't think I'd have enjoyed my time at this bar. Not a bad place to if you're working in the 2-3 block radius if you're just looking for a solid drink and don't mind the noise.
author: Phillip K.

description:
In full disclosure, I first visited Natoma Cabana for a Yelp event when they just opened and thought it was a charming space with lots of potential. On return visits though, it became apparent that the space isn't as well designed to handle the mass of humanity post work. 

During weekday happy hour, it gets really packed and the bar is just a cluster of a mess making it very difficult, and long, to get a drink. Having more defined spaces at the bar for orders might ease the confusion. They do have comfortable spaces to lounge on the main floor but those typically get taken up super early. Quite likely you might end up in the loft area but the problem with most loft areas, like the one at Limon in the Mission, is that it gets really loud with all the reverb being that close to the ceiling. 

Not completely writing off Natoma Cabana yet. I can see it working on the weekends when it's less hectic but I'm probably going to give it a skip after work when there are easier watering holes nearby to enjoy a drink.
author: Jon L.

description: So yummy tasty drinks! Get the lo pi mai tai! Bartender Aaron is also really nice. Hidden location, follow the arrow. You can do it. You'll find it.
author: Carol S.

description:
I can't speak to the drinks or service here - since I just stuck with water, but I had an absolutely enchanting time here last night.

It was my first time at Natoma Cabana and I adore it's hidden location  - nestled on the far corner of the street where John Colins used to live.  Decorated with Ian Ross' signature mural art and boasting a picturesque high ceiling nicely accentuated with simple yet charming lighting - the space is inviting and intimate. Like his much loved Sentinel and Golden West sandwich locations - Dennis Leary (with Eric Passetti) has created a straightforward space that those "in the know" gravitate to. Though the downstairs area did seem busy and the bar hard to get to - I really enjoyed kicking back in the stunning wood lined upstairs area which our group had reserved in advance. 

If you're looking to host a private gathering in the Financial District during the weekday - I highly recommend reaching out to Natoma Cabana. I imagine that it must be more difficult to reserve space on the weekend - but for a small group their upstairs is lovely.

Trust.
author: Jessica T.

description: I like the seats here and the music that this bar plays. The music is pretty loud on weekends so if you're looking to have quality conversation, I would suggest some other place... unless you're on a date and you wanna get close to hear the other person better ;). It can get pretty crowded after work. I love the moscow mules here!!!!!!!!!!!!
author: Annie S.

description: Love this place. Super cute atmosphere and great drinks! Awesome location in the middle of the financial district that makes it perfect for the after work drink with friends.
author: Erica D.

description: This is a hidden spot down Natoma St. Ambience is great, lots of seating and the upstairs part is great for a big crowd. But the bartender was very slow at taking each individual order and ringing them up rather than taking a few drinks at a time. I ended up waiting at least 25 min to order a drink.
author: Joy-Alonica B.

description: Only giving it 3 stars because the music and layout. Drinks were great! Atmosphere was chill on a Thursday night. BUT the layout is weird. The dj on a Thursday was mediocre. No fluidity to his transitions. It's a very cute spot and I love the location!
author: Melissa M.

description: The DJ on Thursday was shitty. Didn't know how to mix music properly and there wasn't an even flow to the music. The drinks were good tho, so 3 stars.
author: Daniel M.

description:
This place is really cute, I just wish that I could have a party there to enjoy it all to myself! We had to stand because even at 5:30 it was packed, and there was a private party on the second level so we couldn't even go up there. 

I had one drink and for $12 it wasn't bad but wasn't great either. The service was really fast, they obviously know what they are doing! 

I think that the theme is my favorite part, I may just have to come back to try and get a cabana.
author: Stephanie D.

description:
Great alleyway bar in San Francisco. I think it is relatively new bar that just opened up few blocks away from 111 Minna. The bar aims to follow a Tropical themed environment as if you are hanging out in Hawaii sipping on a margarita. As you enter in they have a swinging chair style seating with a very relaxed atmosphere.

I would def check it out if you're looking to converse in a relaxed environment.
author: Kunal T.

description: Place is nice, plays old school hip hop music. It's at the end of an alley so there's no parking. Drinks were also good.  Small and cozy place to chill with friends.
author: KB B.

description:
I came here last year after Prince died, with the intent of dancing - they already had a Prince DJ party planned before his untimely death (RIP), so I took public transportation all the way downtown, because I really, really wanted to dance to Prince.
My bf and I paid at the door ($10?) to get in. But the music was just like oonz oonz oonz music that I couldn't identify as Prince at all. (To be fair, I never go to da club so maybe this was my fault.)
The crowd was hella Burning Man-esque. Some were dressed up for the event, but were wearing, like, purple Halloween Superstore boas and shiny synthetic shirts that Prince himself would not have touched with a ten-foot pole.
The inside is weird and has astroturf, which people were dancing on.
After around 15 minutes of trying in vain to get the brotender (see what I did there?) to acknowledge us, I got the bright idea of leaving. The ladies at the door were super nice and gave us our money back, and that was the end of visiting Natoma Cabana for me.
author: Mary S.

description: Came here during How Weird 2016 since it was located literally right next to one of the stages. Cut setup, lighting, bartenders. They had a DJ and were slammed most of the time, but wait time for drinks was never that bad. Hopefully the setup is always the same so we can come again next year. (:
author: Shawna A.

description: Place is a bit old school. Let me tell ya, I did not fit in as I was the only person in a White Sox Jersey and everyone else was dressed up around 5pm on a Saturday. I had 2 drinks then went home. The bartender was cool and super friendly. I was also pretty sauced.
author: Brian H.

description:
Perfect place to sit back, relax and take a chill pill.

I had a fondness for this place when it was John Collins, but seasons change, I guess.  And I actually really like what they did with the joint.  First, did you take note of the exterior artwork courtesy of Ian Ross?  Just something to keep you busy if you're hanging outside.

But inside is really where it's at.  If you can snag one of the uber cool swinging cabana chairs, by all means, order your drink and post up there. If not, then the bar is always a cool spot, but the upstairs mezzanine area is by far my favorite.  Cozy and semi-privado, there's plenty of seating to go around.  

The only reason I'm not giving the five?  I really can't say...It just feels like they didn't do too much with the ambiance, I guess.  Kinda feels divey in some ways. I'm sure it will warm up if they stick around.

See you at Happy Hour!
author: Angella S.

description:
As we approached the last of the dead-end road, we wondered if we made it or not. Our Lyft driver, no longer cheerful, was waiting for us to get out so he can zip away as fast as his pink-mustached sedan can carry. 
We came up to a spooky entrance with nothing but a flickering neon arrow sign pointing to the front door.
We open it slowly not knowing what to expect...

*creeeek...*

To a tropical Cabana Get-Away!!!

*cue tropical music*

Yes, this non-descript on the outside is actually a mini bar getaway on the inside. Plush couches and chairs line the front as you make your way to the back where the bartender is busy pouring shots and beer-filled red cups. A dj is spinning a mix of hip-hop/EDM/top 40 as you grab your liquor of choice and head upstairs. There, even more plushy couches line the walls as christmas lights illuminate your eyes to the ceiling. The entire rooftop is opened up with a skylight-getting an amazing view of the San Francisco skyscrapers and the moon towering over.

I believe this place will get more crowded as more people learn of it. I even ran into Chuck N. here! 
Very relaxed environment, and quite cozy. A nice change of pace from other bars in the area!
author: Lanie L.

description:
I was really excited for Natoma Cabana, because 1) it has such a fun name and 2) the last two times that I've been trying to go, I've been turned around, so this place MUST be nice right?

Unfortunately, it's just a mediocre bar. I ordered a Moscow Mule and it wasn't worth the $12 that I paid for. My sister also ordered a Manhattan and it wasn't made right (there was no orange peel!). As Yelp describes my review, "Meh. I've experienced better."
author: Christina C.

description:
Great place, misleading menu: 

I ordered the Fresca Cooler and one would think from the "Specials Menu" that all the drinks in the "Specials Menu box" were $8, but the bartender says that just the drink directly next to the $8 is $8. 
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/natoma-cabana-san-francisco-3?select=-cfJJERlxM4JoQY4BBld3g#Z4hHOY4kOucp-ESw2e9TjQ

As you can see from my tab, the drink I ordered (which is also in the Specials Menu box) is $ll. Not going to argue w/ the bartender but on principal, it should be more clear. If each drink is a different price, then there should be a price next to all the drinks in the specials menu, not a box containing multiple drinks and one price. 
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/natoma-cabana-san-francisco-3?select=-cfJJERlxM4JoQY4BBld3g#L3PrEAOYkylnDwkBPzZDjA
author: Angelo F.

description:
Natoma Cabana has an indoor-outdoor scenario. It's nice, new, wood. It's a very cool place. We want enough people to come here for it to stay open. But not enough to ruin it. 

Great neon. Cool bartender. Good drink list. Love the loft with the view of the skyscrapers through the skylight! A very nice addition to the neighborhood. Look for the arrow at the end of the block.
author: Ted R.

description:
Ooooo I love this place! Natoma is a trendy bar with a cool vibe, good drinks, and awesome music. I came here on a Saturday night for a friend's birthday, and I must say I was rather impressed. The bartenders were attentive even though it was a busy night, and the drinks were strong (and tasty). The bar is located on the first floor and there's a small lounge on the second floor with tables and seats. 

One thing to note: This place is well hidden with no signage. It's located within an alley on Natoma, and its entryway is lit up with a big neon arrow and black & white artwork on their wall.
author: Nicole P.

description:
mmm, this place is LEGIT! it's difficult to count how many times i've been here, but this place definitely shows up on my credit card statement more than a few times per month.  

the ambiance is just right for happy hours or if you want to get a drink with a friend or a date, and the furnishings are just so adorable! grab a seat at a cabana and you're good to go. or cozy up to the bar and get your drink super fast! the cocktails are all pretty delicious, and very varied depending on your choice of poision. 

i just wish they had foooood, then i would stay here forever.. :P
author: Christina L.

description:
Popped in for a pint at the new Dennis Leary and Eric Passetti spot on opening night.  I was interested after being introduced to their other two spots (Trocadero Club and Cafe Terminus) through Yelp Elite events.  Plus I had been to the former establishment at this location a couple of times (John Colins) and when looking for a new place in SF a few years ago, I seriously considered a place right down the street.

The atmosphere was warm and friendly.  It was a little crowded but not overwhelming.  I imagine it will get pretty crazy on a Friday post work hours.  It will be interesting to see how they handle the crowds then.  The noise level was tolerable, but again I wonder what it will be like when the place is cranking.

When I was there it was still light out, so there was a nice glow of light from the windows in the ceiling.  What do you call them?  they aren't really skylights since its like half the ceiling.  anyway ... the loft area is is a nice touch.  It was there back in the JC days as a VIP area on busy nights, but never went up there then. 

I didn't try a cocktail, I was in a pint mood. That said, the selection of spirits looks reasonable - a decent mix of well and high end spirits without trying to have everyone imaginable.  The bartenders seemed fairly efficient with only a few "where the heck is that" moments.  And my pint was from a fresh keg.

so overall pretty good.  I'd like to go back a couple of times and get the overall feel for the place as it settles into who it really is.
author: Jeff H.

description: So this place was pretty cool! I checked it out for a networking event through Culture Amp. I would have taken photos but probably wasn't the time since I was there to yah know, network. It has a loft style upstairs and brick walls which I liked. It gave it a different and unique vibe that you don't often see here on the West Coast. I also loved the canopy - because I kind of love naps. I'd love to check it out and use it for a private event of my own.
author: Sierra R.

description:
Well I have been here twice now and just love it!! 

It does get a tad crowded, but it comes with the good tunes, drinks, and service. I like that there is an upstairs and several little cozy spots for hanging out. 

The servers are quick and friendly, and know how to pour a drink. My friend got my a mixed drink which I was not trilled about since I only drink whiskey straight. Forgot the name of it, but the drink did have whiskey in it, and it was really good! I was pleasantly surprised! 

They have a full bar and can make what you want. What a great place to hit up for a drink or two after work to take the edge off!
author: Morgan F.

description: Having become a regular at Cafe Terminus, I've been fortunate enough to get to know both Dennis and Eric quite well.  A few co-workers and I headed down the street for their pre-opening launch party and it was SO much fun!  Both guys really know what they're doing, and the space they created at Natoma Cabana is GORGEOUS.  The amazing natural light that comes through the windows, the quaint string of lights around the open space, the whimsical graffiti art that is on the front of the buildling, the "I feel like I'm in someone's backyard but I'm inside" look, and of course, Eric's cocktail creations behind the bar really make this place an awesome spot to hang out whether it's rain or shine.  I definitely look forward to coming back here, congrats Dennis and Eric!
author: Lisa I.

description: First time in SF. Jared and Aaron were so welcoming I want to move here. Had no problem spending money here. I'm from LA so that's what I do. I love deserts. And desserts
author: AJ C.

description:
Stopped in here with my team from work on a Friday at 6PM, along with everybody else in the city apparently. It was pretty packed, but to the bartenders' credit nobody from my group waited more than 5 minutes or so to be served. Solid whiskey sour game.

The crowd thinned out a bit by 7 or 7:30, and it was more comfortable to hang out. Next time I come with a group, I will probably try to reserve the upstairs.
author: Andrew R.

description: Small and cozy place, good music. The bartender we had SUCKS!! Jay (I think that is his name, dark hair, ponytail, nose stud) is rude AF. Rude, rude, rude. Rolls his eyes at patrons when they order, takes orders from people who just walk up to the bar whereas many have been waiting much longer. Many of my friends had terrible a experience with this bartender as well, reporting many eye rolls and sighs from him. Only cracked a smile when my friend bought him a shot of expensive whiskey. He could learn a thing or two about customer service. Will not be coming back because of the terrible bar service. I can go buy my $12 cocktails somewhere else.
author: Diana N.

description:
I came in with my company for happy hour, and the place wasn't too crowded yet at 430 on a Friday.

I ordered a whiskey sour first but wasn't a fan since it was too sweet for my taste, so I ended up just getting cognac on the rocks.

The bottle of Remy was low so the bartender went to the back and didn't find another. He said "I'll top it off later". Okayyy. Should have seen that as a red flag to begin with. But I drank almost everything I had in about 15 mins and asked to top it off. The bartender (who did remember telling me that he would top it off) said they had absolutely no more cognac. Which I found really hard to believe? How do you run out off ALL your cognac on a Friday afternoon? I asked if he could give me anything else (since I already paid for my drink) and he just said no.

Will definitely not be back. Although the locations a little weird (in this sketchy alley), I really did like the interior. Bummer.
author: Camille A.

description:
I love this little bar! 

If you only take away one point from this review, take this: the Whiskey Vic is an amazing whiskey cocktail. I usually drink Old Fashioned's but I opted for something different and I'm glad I did.

Other observations:
- This place is tucked away discreetly away from the main street. You're unlikely to find it just by wandering in
- It's filled with lots of lounge chairs and couches, so there are plenty of convenient places to sit. The benches upstairs can accommodate bigger groups too
- It's not super crowded. This was a pro for me, since I was there to hang out and talk with the person I came with. It may be a con for you if you're looking to meet new people
- Despite not being crowded, the place is loud due to the loud music. It was a good playlist at least
- The staff was super friendly. The bartender/bouncer in particular was a really cool guy

Only con: my partner ordered a cocktail called the Odeon. It's made with champagne as an ingredient, and they used really cheap-tasting champagne. Her drink was not nearly as good as mine (she also ended up drinking half of mine as a result).
author: Dan D.

description:
Really cute venue! It makes you feel like you're in your own private cabana somewhere outdoors!

I'm not a fan of alcohol, however, the owner, was kind enough to make me a virgin drink with fresh watermelon juice, club soda and mint! During the yelp event, I had a lot of people asking me what kind of drink I had and that it looked really good!
author: Petra S.

description:
My friend and I came here after our run club to get a drink. I've also been here for a birthday before. I saw a few people order apps, but I think it best serves as a HH spot. I had the sangria and my gf had one of their cocktails. They served the sangria in a plastic glass, which was odd. 

The vibe inside is very relaxed and I love all the string lights! They also have an upstairs lounge area. This is a great place for large groups!
author: Shana B.

description:
What a great find!

Cozy, lounge-y space off the beaten path. Went here on a weeknight when all the crazies were out after a Giants playoff game and it was perfect! Quiet, nice atmosphere, friendly bartender.
author: Kim C.

description:
You get to this place from 2nd street. Don't try off of 1st. The yelp map looks like it goes through, but no go.

Super cute! Way comfy, and bartenders are nice. 

Get the Antidote if you appreciate Mezcal.
author: Amy O.

description:
A not-so-overrun bar in Soma! Awesome.

Good beer selection, cool upstairs section you can reserve in advance if you have a big crew coming. Cool chairs, cool ambiance, and astro-turf. 

Bartenders are easy to get a hold of, and quick to get you out of there if you're in a hurry. Definitely coming back. 

The good: not a douchey vibe!
The bad: Can get crowded downstairs, but eh.
author: Amanda B.

description: A little overcrowded on a Friday after work but I guess that's to be expected in SOMA. Drinks were fine but nothing out of the park.
author: Michail Y.

description:
I have hosted 2 events ( a Birthday party and a networking get together) and loved it. The staff is amazing! Eric and Stephen are great and super accommodating! 

For the Birthday party we had the space mostly to ourselves (they made it a private party for a couple hours). It does get crowded, but it comes with the good tunes (you can actually plug in your own Iphone / Pandora if you like, drinks, and service. I like that there is an upstairs and several little cozy spots for hanging out. They have a full bar and can make what you want. They dont serve food but suggested we order and bring our own / do catering. 

For the get together, the place was busy, but we had the upstairs area all to ourselves (again was made as a private party area). Since it was after work hours (HH), the place was packed. 

I recommend this place either for HH or the start of the night. They take reservations for private parties too..... the ambiance is really nice and the staff is super friendly. Great place for a drink or HH.
author: Sepi N.

description:
HIDDEN GEM! 

This is mine and many of my co-workers favorite lounges. It's a fantastic spot for a Friday after work turn up! This lounge seems to be more of an "after work club" where you get in at 6pm and leave by 9/10pm. Great atmosphere, great environment, loud and good music. If you come with a big group you will for sure have a good time. Drinks are a bit pricey but strong on the end. 

Do not recommend if you're here looking to catch up with a friend
author: Michael L.

description: Good drinks L! Had he whiskey Vic's. Looked clean and it was pretty fast service for a Saturday night
author: Sophia P.

description:
This is a cosy and slick-but-not-too-slick cocktail bar, stashed away in a nook in SoMa.

I wish I could give it an extra half-star, but alas I can't give it a 5. The music was always great. Sitting at the bar is lovely. The cocktails could be made with a little more care. Stick to the plentiful list of straight spirits and you won't go far wrong.

Oh, and if it's cold ask them to shut the door!
author: Mike P.

description: Cool spot tucked away. ... Look for the lighted green arrow.  Inside is a comfortable and we'll appointed bar with some tasty cocktails.   There is an upstairs loft with a beachy feel with seating and skylights.   Easy walk from Financial District and ATT park.
author: D M.

description:
Just wandering around soma. Saw a green arrow. Went in, greeted with a definite hole in the wall. Cabana seating, lawn chairs, and an upper mezzanine with amazing sound and sights of the soma building lights. 

Ordered a whiskey Vic. And it was done right..

Cool ambience. Definitely coming back soon!
author: Vic V.

description: I love the vibe of this place! The way this place is set up/decorated is great! The prices are a little pricey but I guess thats what you get for drinking in the city. Not giving it 5 stars because when I went there with friends the bartender was a *ick just very rude not interested in providing good customer service.
author: Nina M.

description:
This place is PACKED during happy hour. I came here with my coworkers hoping to have some downtime with them. It was really crowded and the music was blasting so loud, we could hear from a block away.

We decided to grab a drink and maybe hit up another spot. It took us nearly ONE HOUR just to order our ONE drink! The one bartender there did not give us the time of day. I'm pretty sure he saw us too, what a jerk. By this time, we were all pissed and super annoyed. Like, where the heck are we? some adolescent clubbing event? We didn't get our drinks until the other bartender came back and he served us pretty quickly after he acknowledged us.

I can't really judge on the drinks, since I only had a beer. You can't go terribly wrong with beer. However, I am definitely not planning to come back because not only was it a waste of my time, happy hours should be happy. no jerks allowed :)
author: Jenny M.

description: Nice drinks and clean bright space. A little on the loud side, especially when the dance music got turned up.
author: Michael R.

description:
This place was beyond horrible. When are venues going to learn that networking events at happy hour are meant for people to mingle and HEAR EACH OTHER'S CONVERSATION!!!

Beyond this, absolutely the most VAPID wine-by-the-glass menu I have ever encountered (regurgitated here):
     
      SPARKLING Cava
      SPARKLING Malbec Rose
      PINOT NOIR Chile
      MALBEC Argentina
      ALBARIÑO Argentina
      SAUVIGNON Chile

Which vintage? Which winery? And what the f*** is Sauvignon? Cabernet Sauvignon? Sauvignon Blanc? And why only imported wines?

Why not list VODKA Poland or BOURBON Kentucky on the menu, as well? UTTER MORONS!!!

I ABSOLUTELY hated this place, so much so that I left the event there an hour early because it was so insufferable.
