I hope for Ian Ross' sake, someone paints over his exterior or it will drastically devalue his art if this idiotic place stays in business.
author: Marc C.

description: Really good old fashions with interesting aromatics. Friendly staff. Chill music. Casual, tiki Barnes que vibe.
author: Lauren K.

description:
This is a very cool and relatively new spot in the Financial District. I've been for a happy hour and we had part of the upper level reserved on a Friday early in the afternoon. I loved the atmosphere here; at least when I went it was not too loud so it was easy to chat. It got more crowded and loud as time went by.
The drinks are tasty and affordable. I did not explore the menu but it looked like they had a good selection of beers, too.
I think it's a great place to try since it's located in a small alleyway so not many people coming in & out, and not much noise from the street. I recommend coming here early, though, because once I came by around 6pm on a Friday and it would have been impossible to sit or have a chat.
author: Dodi G.

description: Loved this spot during a recent office happy hour.  First off, the space itself is really cool and second, if you can snag a seat up front it's pretty spacious and comfy.  Only downside is that you have to bear the crowd to grab your drinks and then carry them all the way up front.  Cocktail service would have been nice where we were.  There may have been cocktail service but we were never approached about putting in an order.  Other than that, great after work hour place if you're looking for a spot nearby to convene.
author: Kirsten M.

description: I hesitate to even say this, but the Natoma Cabana is the hidden gem of the SOMA/ FiDi area. Somehow, the mobs of techies that invade every popular Happy Hour spot in this area have yet to discover Natoma. Interior design has a super cute cabana style vibe (thus the name) with a cool graffiti mural on the exterior. They have a decent beer/wine selection but it pales in comparison to their craft cocktails- DELICIOUS... the 'Pocket Square' was on point.
author: Rosie A.

description: Had been to this bar a multiple times and generally have a good time. And always get decent service. But the bartender working on 2/9/16 pass up on my order and friends twice. After waiting 20 mins I had to leave. I guess Brown & Black lives Don't matter here. Won't be going to this establishment ever again.
author: Calvin B.

description:
The bartenders here are very nice and attentive. They're very willing to give recommendations and make an array of tasty cocktails.

The ambiance is very hip and island-chic. You can sit in a papasan chair and be all like "Whoa, I'm in Hawaii! Snapchat this, quick! The breeze is a-coming." There's also an upstairs where you can lean over the railing like you're on a ship. 

I was there on a really crowded night, but both toilets were overflowed. Very problematic in a place where toilets are definitely needed. You don't have to go full island, Natoma.
author: Sam D.

description:
Changing my review since it did turn out to be a misunderstanding. The extra was credit authorization. Apologize for the earlier misleading review. I'm giving them back the review they deserve. 



I give 1 star because the bartender there is shady and dishonest. We had a company HH there today. I ordered a glass of wine which was $10. When I went home and checked my credit card online statement, I realized he charged me extra 50 cents on top of what I tipped him hoping that I would not notice. Our team goes there quite often because of the location and the vibe. So it is really disappointing to know that you can trust the place you go for HH all the time.  It is only 50 cents but I heard that's what those bartenders do so you wouldn't notice. I bet this guy does this all the time. Remember, it doesn't matter how nice the place is, the bartender can always cheat you! Always check your CC statement! Shame on you, Natoma!
author: Run Y.

description: Cool ambience, drinks were about $12 and were average. The service was good though and my friends and I were able to dance around on the first floor since it wasn't too busy. The 2nd floor was closed off.
author: Seka M.

description: Excellent atmosphere with great drinks and friendly bartenders. The skylights let a ton of light in during the day and I'm assuming are very cool at night looking at the buildings. Wicker lounge chairs are throughout and are very comfortable to hang out in.
author: Stephen S.

description: The shittiest bar service I've ever received at a bar. Tuesday night after work with several seats available - came in and ordered one round, sat at the bar and got serious side eye and attitude because I asked for a menu and took a couple of minutes. Tipped anyway. BIG MISTAKE. Was completely ignored for round 2 for 15 minutes. Bartender kept checking his phone and ignoring the 3 of us. Won't be back.
author: Nicole B.

description: Bartender here is incredibly rude. Pants are too tight and he can't stop chewing gum.
author: Samantha R.

description: Natoma Cabana sits at the end of a little alley off 2nd street and serves excellent craft cocktails.  Bartenders are friendly and drinks come up quickly, really a good experience.  Great lounge setting, crowd was small on a recent weeknight visit.
author: Patrick S.

description:
Awesome hidden new lounge in Soma w/a few major issues. It has a great upstairs loft area that can be reserved, bartenders make strong drinks, the ambience and decor is awesome (some egg like pod / beds to relax in).

There are some things they could do is: 1.) sign outside, unless you know about it you'll never know it's a bar. 2.) More bartenders. 2 bartenders on both busy nights i've been and it takes me 20 mins to give you my money, very bad. Offer more drinks on your menu. It's limited to about 10 cocktail specials. There needs to be more.

Service is good, place is great. Want to give it 5 stars, but needs to work on staffing.
author: Chuck N.

description: Yelp Elite took over this joint a little while ago for Yelp's birthday, and I had a bit of trouble finding the place... It looks like the end of an alley, next to construction. That can't be the bar, can it...? But you walk up and it's a legit cabana party! The drinks were good, and strong. The bartenders were super sweet and accommodating. Upstairs is like an indoors backyard patio, which is especially nice when SF is unexpectedly chilly, expectedly.
author: Vivian H.

description:
I love coffee. 

I love coffee inspired cocktails even more. Not the bailey's with your rum kind of crap, but straight coffee forward flavored cocktails that you can enjoy sipping slow and steady. 

The bartender at this new spot also works at Novella, and the moment I saw him, I knew I'd be in good hands. 

The coffee cocktail they offer here is on point. I loved it! Only thing is, when I asked for another, they ran out of the Espresso liquor to make it! (NOO). But I enjoyed it enough to know I will come back for it. There are not too many in this fair City that I know of. You'd think for a caffeine driven city like San Francisco, they'd have more plays on coffee cocktails.... just sayin' (or wishin')

Other notes:

- just opened recently, menu is sparse. hopefully more drink options will be added on later. maybe even small bites? (nudge)
- odd decor. there is supposed to be a "cabana" kind of feel to the place, with palm trees and outdoor furniture...? i think this might still be an idea that needs to be worked on. the bar is nice and spacious though. i was expecting chips and salsa to come with my drink the way things appeared to be. 
- no outside signage, only an arrow pointing you to where you enter. 

I'll be back.
author: Maureen B.

description: Small but cozy. Great music - Indie Rock on a Friday night. Brick walls remind me of the East Coast. Great lounging areas. Will be back on another night.
author: Moua L.

description: Awesome bar & lounge in SOMA / Financial District perfect for drinks after work. Brought a group of coworkers here last Friday and the place had a great vibe going at 5pm (early! & just got better from there). Attracts a good crowd, had a live DJ playing upbeat music and the bartenders were super attentive. Great cocktail menu and really fun decor - we were up in the lofted area where it's roomy and cozy at the same time, lots of couches and chairs for sitting and still space to dance. One of the owner's, Eric, is super friendly to work with if booking a larger event (their cafe Terminus is a great spot too for lunch!).
author: Allison C.

description: This place has potential, but with how crowded it is, how long you have to wait to get a drink, and how loud the music is, I honestly don't think it's worth visiting. After waiting "like 80 hours" (according to my friend) for just a glass of wine, it ended up being $10! It wasn't a particularly generous pour or particularly good wine either. On top of there not being nearly enough bartenders, they weren't even that friendly. It honestly pained me to tip even $1. I genuinely think you will have a better experience elsewhere. Do not recommend.
author: Emily M.

description: This is a great spot for after work drinks! It has a fun ambiance and feels very tropical despite being in the heart of the city. It does get very crowded the later it gets and the music gets louder and louder by the minute. It is actually pretty ridiculous. So if you are looking for a spot that is easy to chat and just lounge, this probably isn't the best place. But the cocktails are good!
author: Harmony H.

description: The bartender (not Gabriel) is extremely rude. Their credit card machine stopped working. Which is fine, stuff happens. But the way in which the bartender reacted was  rude and uncalled for. We were there for a company event, spending over a thousand dollars. We had just paid our bill  and we're opening up another tab when the machine stopped working.The bartender told us he couldn't serve us drinks until we proved we had cash to pay for it. He also told my friend that he doesn't trust us to pay. After spending that much money on a corporate deal that they could verify and track down, this was mind boggling. They were rude to multiple people in the group throughout the evening. The place is nice but the service (minus Gabriel) is demeaning.
author: Nisa Q.

description: I love the venue, from the outside and the inside. The drinks are on the pricer side but if you want to explore something new try it.
author: Michèle S.

description:
Very cool & unique! 

Great cocktails, but the atmosphere is what will keep me coming back. Really chill & loungey seating, big bright skylights, trendy warehouse/loft... Just perfect! 

Pretty busy after work but calmed down after 8ish. 

Perfect spot to have a drink and unwind with a friend or two :)
author: Shanna N.

description: My favorite bar in SoMa.  My girlfriend ordered their old-fashioned, it came with an orange rind and a large round ball of ice (like it's supposed to, in order to minimize the rate at which the ice melts).  I didn't try it, but it smelled amazing.  The atmosphere was friendly and relaxing, and we were lucky enough to get a couch all to ourselves.
author: Richie T.

description: Love the venue and have had a good time grabbing drinks here after work. I came here on a Saturday night recently they had hip hop blasting on the speakers so it was a much different vibe than the after-work crowd. It was like Raven but with an older Marina-type crowd. One major downside is the bartenders took forever to get to me and skipped me several times for other patrons that walked up to the bar after me. It might have been a coincidence but all those other patrons were white and I'm not.  My other non-white friend said she had a similar experience that night as well. Maybe it was coincidence, maybe it wasn't, but it is something I'm keeping an eye out for next time I go.
author: Alex P.

description: I really wanted to love it here.  I've been a couple of times and each time there is a big crowd but the space has really high open ceilings and great light so it doesn't feel too stuffy. But the bartenders seem like they are bothered by the fact that guests are there.  They don't make eye contact or work the length of the bar. And because the bar is in a narrow space people have to smooth into the people drinking at the bar and have to yell at the bartenders in order to get service.  They need to work on their customer service. I know that setup doesn't make it easy but they need to do something to improve. It could be an amazing place for drinks.
author: Jean C.

description: Cool new bar!! The old John Collins and they did a great job with it! Had a beet and a cocktail, and they did a fantastic job with my Gran Classico Negroni! Bartender was super friendly and super inviting (gotta grab his name....)! All in all, must check out this new cool spot
author: Hubert L.

description: Good energy, cool ambiance, great venue space! We rented out the mezzanine for a friends birthday party. Loved the ceiling windows looking up to the financial district and the coral colored lights adorning the space. Will definitely be back to this swanky spot!
author: Caroline J.

description: Had a going away party for 12 friends, Tony the bartender was incredible, music was great and the location was warm, inviting and unique.   Look forward to going back and would absolutely hold an event here again.
author: Kate R.

description: Visiting San Francisco, we felt like regulars on our very first visit. So much that we came back later that night. Matt was a great bartender!
author: Quentin C.

description:
Awesome place for private events!  We hosted a private party in the full space and it was perfect from start to finish.  The bar tenders are all super friendly and helpful and had a great attitude through the looong night.  The decor is awesome and they were amazing with set up, clean up and helping us make the night run smoothly.  Will definitely throw more parties here!  
Our party was for ~80 people which we thought was pretty perfect for the full space.
author: Rebecca B.

description: I really REALLY want to like this place. I tried to let it go but now find I have to write a review. I had to plan a happy hour for a work event and emailed the coordinator at Natoma Cabana (which I believe turned out to be the owner or manager) to reserve the upstairs lounge. He was super nice and offered to waive the minimum since we'd be arriving before the Friday happy hour rush. Unfortunately, my boss's presentation went too late and we were about 30 minutes late to arrive. The contact emailed me asking if we were still planning on reserving the spot, I responded within 5 minutes confirming and apologizing for running late. When we arrived, they had already started to open the reserved section to other guests even though it wasn't busy. When checking-in with the contact, I asked if he received my reply and his response was "I haven't checked my email". Although the people were kind enough to move from our previously reserved section, he came back and said to not turn people away since we were late. There was no language in the original email correspondence stipulating that the reservation would be given up after a certain period of time. I fully understand their need to operate as a business, but seriously? This was not the customer service I expected by a venue, which has many private events. This was a few months ago and have since avoided this place until tonight. I went in for happy hour tonight because my friend wanted to go (only reason!). The owner/contact was at the bar and completely blackballed and refused to serve us. To the point he acknowledged my friend and turned the other way... Not to help serve someone else but to drink a glass of water! I refuse to come back. Like I said, I really want to like this place for the location (I work less than a block away) and craft cocktails. But wow, they lost some good business from me and my co-workers.
author: Ashley M.

description: This is the place for you if you like saunas! The ice in my drink melted before I was halfway through. That said, the atmosphere is nice
author: Charlotte H.

description: Great cocktails! Bad bouncer. Booked this place for NYE, and then we were waiting for our uber and it was 145am and the bouncer told us to leave immediately. Seriously? It's like 15 minutes left, and he was like "don't argue with me". Wow ok, sure we'll leave right now, even though our cab is arriving in 10 mins, and we booked you until 2am.
author: Banjo I.

description: First of all I love the name Natoma Cabana and the painting on the front done by Ian Ross. Large open space, great music, and wonderful atmosphere. Every time I have been here I had an amazing time. The bartenders are always very nice and service is quick. Love the drink menu on the recycled cardboard too. It is fun and tropical with all the plants and comfy seating. Also love the fact that it is off the main street and you can hang out in front and chat. If you have a chance sit and lounge with your friends in the birdcage!
author: Nicole P.

description: Cocktails aren't that good. I've had better. Only cool thing about this place is the music, decor and look of it from the outside. That's pretty much all they have going on for them here.
author: Diane L.

description: Drinks are made well. Nice Atmosphere. They make the most of the space they have. May be rented out for private events
author: Joshua L.

description: This place had just the right chill vibe.  Great music,  easy to talk and hang out with a good drink.  Upstairs is a great place to catch up or bring a date.  It my be the best place I have visited in soma to just chill.  Hard to find but worth it.
author: David F.

description: I came here for my birthday and spoke to the manager a week beforehand to book the upstairs part of the bar. Turns out there was a wedding party who had booked the space all night. The doorman and the bartenders were not accommodating and did not provide any sort of thing to apologize for over booking, or the fact it was my birthday and brought 15 people to their business. To say rude and pretentious would be an understatement. The bar was empty and played sad music right when we walked in and It's my fault that I didn't decide to leave right then. I am so disappointed with this establishment and how they treat their customers.
author: Erica E.

description: This place gave my credit card to someone else who used it at two other bars the same night. So I recommend bringing cash.
author: Ricky R.

description: Sneaky cool location! Interesting decor. Good wine, but pricey. Upstairs is good for small groups.
author: Alice A.

description: One of the lively bars in FiDi.  The least sausage festy of all the downtown bars during happy hour filled with tech dudes.  Cool lay out, but get some fans upstairs it gets hot.
author: Jay H.

description: Really cute spot with great cocktails.  Only issue was that they had zero TVs to watch the A's wildcard game.  SHAME.
author: Josie A.

description: Trendy cute hidden little gem at the end of Natoma. I never knew it was there, kinda hard to tell what it is from the outside. I've been for happy hours a few times and it's always poppin', good music, nice bartenders, great space. Drink prices are about average for the area, don't think they really have a happy hour. Exposed brick walls, split level, fair amount of seating...cool space, check it out!
author: Ashley H.

description: Awesome new bar in SOMA. HIdden in an alley. Great, fun seating. I would guess this will be a good happy hour place after work. Not sure if the weekend night scene will be as active.
author: Kevin K.

description: Came here for a Xmas party event and it was a great venue! The bartenders were fast and knew their stuff. Cosy atmosphere with brick interior finish. There is a loft area with skylights and a decent amount of seating. Good place to host a corporate event!
author: Mel P.

description: No need for music to be blaring so loud that I can't hear the person next to me speaking. Not sure why or how anyone wants to spend downtime after work in a place so flippin loud.  Hated it and ran out quickly last night.
author: Christin A.

description: Came here on a Wednesday night. It was easy to get a drink. Bartender Erik is the man, he was generous to let me try some of the whiskies i had doubt about. I settled with a custom-made whiskey based cocktail (Of a whiskey that i picked) that ended up being delectable. It instantly became my favorite whiskey-based cocktail of all time (Gotta go back and ask what it's called). Definitely visit this bar for delicious cocktails and chilled-as bar staff.
author: Lianne M.

description: Great friendly staff.  A bit of a hard to find bar, but fantastic for company Happy Hours after work.  Totally worth making the trip over there.
author: Patrick S.

description: Cool, cool. Great concept. I love that this place is down an alley, no signs, you just have 'to know where to go'. Relaxed atmosphere, cool exterior design, and well-priced tasty cocktails. Looks to be a great place for groups or private bookings, the upstairs mezz is super cool. I'll be back.
author: Jen S.

description: Great bar. The space is clean and refreshing with some cool sky lights. Super friendly staff and lots of whiskeys to choose from if you're in to that like me! Tucked out of the way and looks divey from the outside but beautiful on the inside!
author: Bosco R.

description: Gorgeous place. Absolutely loved it, and the owner is extremely nice. I ordered the Whiskey Vic which was delicious.... the only reason I am not giving it 5 stars is because it was hard to get a drink. I came in with 5 girls at around 6pm on Friday and we all felt pretty ignored. Wasn't even that busy so I am not sure why it took so long; from walk in to getting a drink took us about 20 minutes. Maybe they are still working out the kinks :)
author: Angelica D.

description: Awesome drinks!  The place has great bartenders and excellent drink selection.  Definitely recommend checking out!
author: Pat D.

description: Love the ambiance. Great place to grab a drink with friends after work. But the cocktail list is limited. The drinks we got were just average. Still, love the vibe and will definitely go back.
author: Rengie C.

description:
Love this place!  It's my new favorite spot.  
Great space, fantastic staff, and delicious drinks.  Highly recommend!
author: Amy B.

description: I run a national events company and we just did a private event here. The space is breathtaking and the staff are superstars! All the bartenders were extremely nice and also efficient. Drinks came out perfectly and our crowd loved the menu! Management was also a pleasure to work with. One of the best bars in San Francisco! we will definitely be back for more events and even just on our own for cocktails :)
author: Sura H.
